Package com.example.fairdraw.DBs

Class UserDB

java.lang.Object
com.example.fairdraw.DBs.UserDB
public class UserDB extends Object
Provides a high-level API for interacting with the "users" collection in Firestore. This class handles all the database operations for User objects.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    UserDB.DeleteCallback
    Callback interface for delete operations on a User.
    static interface 
    UserDB.ExistsCallback
    Callback interface for checking if a user exists in the database.
    static interface 
    UserDB.GetUserCallback
    Callback interface for when a User is fetched from the database.
    static interface 
    UserDB.GetUsersCallback
    Callback interface for when multiple Users are fetched from the database.
    static interface 
    UserDB.WriteCallback
    Callback interface for write operations (add/update) on a User.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserDB

      public UserDB()

  • Method Details

    • getUserOrNull

      public static void getUserOrNull(String deviceId, UserDB.GetUserCallback cb)
      Asynchronously retrieves a User object from the database.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The device ID of the user to retrieve.
      cb - The callback to be invoked with the result. On success: cb.onCallback(user, null). If the document doesn't exist: cb.onCallback(null, null). On failure: cb.onCallback(null, exception).

    • addUserSnapshotListener

      public static com.google.firebase.firestore.ListenerRegistration addUserSnapshotListener(String deviceId, UserDB.GetUserCallback cb)
      Adds a snapshot listener to a user document for real-time updates.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The device ID of the user to listen to.
      cb - The callback to be invoked with the result on each update.
      Returns:
      A ListenerRegistration that can be used to remove the listener.

    • userExists

      public static void userExists(String deviceId, UserDB.ExistsCallback cb)
      Asynchronously checks if a user with the given device ID exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The device ID to check.
      cb - The callback to be invoked with the result. On success: cb.onCallback(exists, null). On failure: cb.onCallback(false, exception).

    • upsertUser

      public static void upsertUser(User user, UserDB.WriteCallback cb)
      Creates or updates a user in the database. If a user with the same device ID already exists, it will be updated. Otherwise, a new user will be created.
      Parameters:
      user - The User object to upsert.
      cb - The callback to be invoked with the result. On success: cb.onCallback(true, null). On failure: cb.onCallback(false, exception).

    • deleteUser

      public static void deleteUser(String deviceId, UserDB.DeleteCallback cb)
      Deletes a user from the database.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The device ID of the user to delete.
      cb - The callback to be invoked with the result. On success: cb.onCallback(true, null). On failure: cb.onCallback(false, exception).

    • listenToUsers

      public static com.google.firebase.firestore.ListenerRegistration listenToUsers(UserDB.GetUsersCallback callback)
